title: On the fractional parts of certain sequences of $\xi \alpha^{n}$
abstract:
Assume that $\alpha>1$ is an algebraic number and $\xi\neq0$ is a real
number. We are concerned with the distribution of the fractional parts of the
sequence $(\xi \alpha^{n})$. Under various Diophantine conditions on $\xi$ and
$\alpha$, we obtain lower bounds on the number $n$ with $1\leq n\leq N $ for
which the fractional part of the sequence $(\xi \alpha^{n})_{n\geq1}$ fall into
a prescribed region $I\subset [0,1]$, extending several results in the
literature. As an application, we show that the Fourier decay rate of some
self-similar measures is logarithmic, generalizing a result of Varj\'{u} and
Yu.
